clusters.title: Russia accuses Ukraine of strike on nuclear plant in wave of drone attacks
clusters.neutral_headline: Russia and Ukraine Exchange Accusations Regarding Nuclear Plant

items.title: Russia accuses Ukraine of strike on nuclear plant in wave of drone attacks
items.standfirst: Moscow says operating capacity of reactor at Kursk site reduced by 50% as Kyiv celebrates independence dayMoscow has accused Kyiv of launching dozens of drone attacks, including one that sparked a fire at a nuclear power plant, as Ukrainians marked 34 years since the country gained independence from the Soviet Union.The drone attack on the Kursk nuclear power plant in western Russia, 37 miles (60km) from the border with Ukraine, caused damage to an auxiliary transformer and forced a 50% reduction in the operating capacity of a reactor, Russian authorities said. Ukraine did not immediately comment on the alleged attack. Continue reading...
items.content: Moscow says operating capacity of reactor at Kursk site reduced by 50% as Kyiv celebrates independence dayMoscow has accused Kyiv of launching dozens of drone attacks, including one that sparked a fire at a nuclear power plant, as Ukrainians marked 34 years since the country gained independence from the Soviet Union.The drone attack on the Kursk nuclear power plant in western Russia, 37 miles (60km) from the border with Ukraine, caused damage to an auxiliary transformer and forced a 50% reduction in the operating capacity of a reactor, Russian authorities said. Ukraine did not immediately comment on the alleged attack. Continue reading...

items.title: Canadian PM Carney attends celebrations on 34th Ukrainian Independence day
items.standfirst: Prime Minister Mark Carney said Ukrainians should have no doubt about Canada's commitment to their country, as he delivered a speech in Sophia Square during a surprise visit to Kyiv. Carney's first visit to Ukraine came on the invitation of President Volodymyr Zelenskyyto mark Ukraine's 34th Independence Day.
items.content: Prime Minister Mark Carney said Ukrainians should have no doubt about Canada's commitment to their country, as he delivered a speech in Sophia Square during a surprise visit to Kyiv. Carney's first visit to Ukraine came on the invitation of President Volodymyr Zelenskyyto mark Ukraine's 34th Independence Day.

items.title: Zelenskyy marks Ukraine Independence Day alongside Canada’s PM in Kyiv
items.standfirst: Ukrainian President Zelenskyy delivered a defiant address against Russia during Ukraine’s Independence Day.
items.content: Ukrainian President Zelenskyy delivered a defiant address against Russia during Ukraine’s Independence Day.

items.title: Ukraine celebrates its 34th Independence Day amid the ongoing war with Russia
items.standfirst: A Ukrainian drone shot down by Russian air defence systems caused a short-lived fire at the Kursk Nuclear Power Plant, the facility's press service said Sunday, stressing that background radiation around the plant remained at "natural levels." The detonation reportedly damaged an auxiliary transformer, reducing the plant's capacity. This comes as Ukraine celebrates its 34th Independence Day this Sunday. The country formally declared independence from the Soviet Union on August 24, 1991. On Saturday, Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky and other officials marked another national holiday, National Flag Day. France24 welcomes Tetyana Ogarkova, Journalist at Ukraine Crisis Media Center from Kyiv.
items.content: A Ukrainian drone shot down by Russian air defence systems caused a short-lived fire at the Kursk Nuclear Power Plant, the facility's press service said Sunday, stressing that background radiation around the plant remained at "natural levels." The detonation reportedly damaged an auxiliary transformer, reducing the plant's capacity. This comes as Ukraine celebrates its 34th Independence Day this Sunday. The country formally declared independence from the Soviet Union on August 24, 1991. On Saturday, Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky and other officials marked another national holiday, National Flag Day. France24 welcomes Tetyana Ogarkova, Journalist at Ukraine Crisis Media Center from Kyiv.

items.title: Ukraine celebrates its 34th Independence Day from Soviet Union
items.standfirst: Ukraine is marking its 34th Independence Day this Sunday, commemorating its formal break from the Soviet Union on August 24, 1991. A day earlier, President Volodymyr Zelensky and other officials observed National Flag Day, another key date in the country’s calendar. Ukrainians at home and abroad are preparing celebrations in dozens of countries, featuring concerts, marches, prayers, and charity events. France 24’s Gulliver Cragg reports from Kyiv.
items.content: Ukraine is marking its 34th Independence Day this Sunday, commemorating its formal break from the Soviet Union on August 24, 1991. A day earlier, President Volodymyr Zelensky and other officials observed National Flag Day, another key date in the country’s calendar. Ukrainians at home and abroad are preparing celebrations in dozens of countries, featuring concerts, marches, prayers, and charity events. France 24’s Gulliver Cragg reports from Kyiv.

items.title: Ukraine celebrates its 34th Independence Day from Soviet Union, after National Flag Day
items.standfirst: A Ukrainian drone shot down by Russian air defence systems caused a short-lived fire at the Kursk Nuclear Power Plant, the facility's press service said Sunday, stressing that background radiation around the plant remained at "natural levels." The detonation reportedly damaged an auxiliary transformer, reducing the plant's capacity. This comes as Ukraine celebrates its 34th Independence Day this Sunday. The country formally declared independence from the Soviet Union on August 24, 1991. On Saturday, Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky and other officials marked another national holiday, National Flag Day. Charlotte Hughes has the details.
items.content: A Ukrainian drone shot down by Russian air defence systems caused a short-lived fire at the Kursk Nuclear Power Plant, the facility's press service said Sunday, stressing that background radiation around the plant remained at "natural levels." The detonation reportedly damaged an auxiliary transformer, reducing the plant's capacity. This comes as Ukraine celebrates its 34th Independence Day this Sunday. The country formally declared independence from the Soviet Union on August 24, 1991. On Saturday, Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky and other officials marked another national holiday, National Flag Day. Charlotte Hughes has the details.

ai_summary: Russia claims a drone attack damaged a reactor at the Kursk nuclear plant, reducing capacity by 50%.
Ukraine has not immediately commented on the alleged attack on the nuclear plant in Russia.
Canadian Prime Minister Mark Carney visited Kyiv for Ukraine's Independence Day celebrations.
Ukrainian President Zelenskyy gave a defiant address during Independence Day celebrations.
Ukraine declared independence from the Soviet Union on August 24, 1991, 34 years ago.

items.title: Trump administration plans to deport newly freed Kilmar Abrego Garcia to Uganda
items.standfirst: The US government is seeking to deport El Salvadoran national Kilmar Abrego Garcia, who was wrongfully expelled from the US in March before returning to face detention in the US, to Uganda, his defence attorneys said Saturday. Abrego Garcia reportedly declined a plea deal that would see him deported to Costa Rica.

items.content: The Trump administration said Friday that Denmark's Ørsted (OTCPK:DNNGY) must halt all activities related to its Revolution Wind project off the coast of Rhode Island, which is under construction and was expected to become operational next year. The Bureau of

items.title: New England states vow to fight Trump administration order to halt work on offshore wind farm that’s nearly complete
items.standfirst: Rhode Island and Connecticut officials say project, slated to power 350,000 homes, is essential to their climate goalsThe Democratic governors of Rhode Island and Connecticut promised on Saturday to fight a Trump administration order halting work on a nearly complete wind farm off their coasts that was expected to be operational next year.The Revolution Wind project was about 80% complete, with 45 of its 65 turbines already installed, according to the Danish wind farm developer Ørsted, when the US Bureau of Ocean Energy Management sent the firm a letter on Friday ordering it to “halt all ongoing activities”. Continue reading...
items.content: Rhode Island and Connecticut officials say project, slated to power 350,000 homes, is essential to their climate goalsThe Democratic governors of Rhode Island and Connecticut promised on Saturday to fight a Trump administration order halting work on a nearly complete wind farm off their coasts that was expected to be operational next year.The Revolution Wind project was about 80% complete, with 45 of its 65 turbines already installed, according to the Danish wind farm developer Ørsted, when the US Bureau of Ocean Energy Management sent the firm a letter on Friday ordering it to “halt all ongoing activities”. Continue reading...

items.title: Trump administration halts work on an almost-finished wind farm
items.standfirst: The Revolution Wind farm was slated to start sending power to homes and businesses in Rhode Island and Connecticut starting next year.
items.content: The Revolution Wind farm was slated to start sending power to homes and businesses in Rhode Island and Connecticut starting next year.(Image credit: Seth Wenig)

ai_summary: The Trump administration ordered Ørsted to halt activities on the Revolution Wind project.
The Revolution Wind project is an offshore wind farm off the coast of Rhode Island.
The project was about 80% complete, with 45 of 65 turbines already installed.
Rhode Island and Connecticut officials vow to fight the order halting the wind farm.
The wind farm was slated to start sending power to homes and businesses next year.

The average donation amount was $121, with equal contributions from in and out of state.
Mamdani is the Democratic nominee for New York City mayor.
He won the Democratic nomination in June against former governor Andrew Cuomo.

items.title: Meta To License AI Lab Midjourney’s Tech in New Partnership
items.standfirst: Meta Platforms Inc. struck a new partnership with artificial intelligence image and video generator Midjourney Inc., giving the tech giant access to the startup’s “aesthetic technology” for its models and products.
items.content: Meta Platforms Inc. struck a new partnership with artificial intelligence image and video generator Midjourney Inc., giving the tech giant access to the startup’s “aesthetic technology” for its models and products.

The deal grants Meta access to Midjourney's image technology for future models.
Meta plans to use Midjourney's technology in its products and research.
Midjourney is a prominent generative AI company specializing in image creation.
The partnership aims to enhance Meta's AI capabilities across its applications.

clusters.title: Bands pull out from festival after group 'cut off' over flag
clusters.neutral_headline: Bands Cancel Festival Performances Due to Flag Controversy

items.title: Bands pull out from festival after group 'cut off' over flag
items.standfirst: Several bands have pulled out from the Victorious music festival just hours before their scheduled performances, following claims by Irish folk group The Mary Wallopers that they were "cut off" for displaying a Palestinian flag.
items.content: Several bands have pulled out from the Victorious music festival just hours before their scheduled performances, following claims by Irish folk group The Mary Wallopers that they were "cut off" for displaying a Palestinian flag.

items.title: Bands boycott music festival after group's set 'cut off'
items.standfirst: The Last Dinner Party, Cliffords and The Academic refuse to perform at Victorious Festival.
items.content: The Last Dinner Party, Cliffords and The Academic refuse to perform at Victorious Festival.

ai_summary: Several bands withdrew from the Victorious music festival before their sets.
The Mary Wallopers claimed they were "cut off" for displaying a Palestinian flag.
The Last Dinner Party, Cliffords, and The Academic also refused to perform.
The festival's organizers have not yet commented on the situation.
The incident sparked a boycott of the festival by multiple musical acts.

clusters.title: Anti-refugee protesters in the UK rally against hotels for asylum seekers
clusters.neutral_headline: Protests Occur Across UK Regarding Asylum Seeker Housing

items.title: Anti-refugee protesters in the UK rally against hotels for asylum seekers
items.standfirst: Far-right protesters and anti-racism campaigners have faced off at rallies across the UK against hotels housing asylum
items.content: Far-right protesters and anti-racism campaigners have faced off at rallies across the UK against hotels housing asylum

items.title: Anti-immigrant protesters and counter-protesters face off across UK
items.standfirst: Protests against the use of hotels to house asylum seekers took place across the UK, with demonstrators gathering in cities such as Bristol, Liverpool, and London, as well as in Mold, Perth, and County Antrim. In many areas, police intervened to keep rival groups apart as anti-racism campaigners staged counter-demonstrations. The unrest follows a High Court ruling earlier this week that blocked plans to use a hotel in Epping, Essex, for asylum accommodation, prompting several local authorities in England to consider launching their own legal challenges. Former British Minister of European Affairs, Denis MacShane, speaks to France24 for further explanations.
items.content: Protests against the use of hotels to house asylum seekers took place across the UK, with demonstrators gathering in cities such as Bristol, Liverpool, and London, as well as in Mold, Perth, and County Antrim. In many areas, police intervened to keep rival groups apart as anti-racism campaigners staged counter-demonstrations. The unrest follows a High Court ruling earlier this week that blocked plans to use a hotel in Epping, Essex, for asylum accommodation, prompting several local authorities in England to consider launching their own legal challenges. Former British Minister of European Affairs, Denis MacShane, speaks to France24 for further explanations.

items.title: Asylum hotel protesters met by counter-demonstrators across UK

In many areas, police intervened to keep rival groups apart as anti-racism campaigners staged counter-demonstrations. The unrest follows a High Court ruling earlier this week that blocked plans to use a hotel in Epping, Essex, for asylum accommodation, prompting several local authorities in England to consider launching their own legal challenges. Simon Moritz and Ethan Hajji tell us more.

In many areas, police intervened to keep rival groups apart as anti-racism campaigners staged counter-demonstrations. The unrest follows a High Court ruling earlier this week that blocked plans to use a hotel in Epping, Essex, for asylum accommodation, prompting several local authorities in England to consider launching their own legal challenges. Simon Moritz and Ethan Hajji tell us more.

items.title: Protests against hotel housing asylum seekers take place across the UK
items.standfirst: Protesters took to the streets in towns and cities across the United Kingdom on Saturday to demonstrate against hotels housing asylum-seekers. Counter-demonstrations were also held in Bristol and Liverpool, where police intervened to keep rival groups apart.
items.content: Protesters took to the streets in towns and cities across the United Kingdom on Saturday to demonstrate against hotels housing asylum-seekers. Counter-demonstrations were also held in Bristol and Liverpool, where police intervened to keep rival groups apart.

ai_summary: Protests occurred across the UK against hotels housing asylum seekers.
Anti-racism campaigners held counter-demonstrations in several cities.
Police intervened to separate opposing groups in some locations.
The protests followed a court ruling blocking a hotel's use for asylum.
Demonstrations took place in cities including Bristol, Liverpool, and London.

clusters.title: Ghislaine Maxwell was given 'platform to rewrite history', say Virginia Giuffre's family
clusters.neutral_headline: Ghislaine Maxwell Interview Release Sparks Outrage

items.title: Ghislaine Maxwell was given 'platform to rewrite history', say Virginia Giuffre's family
items.standfirst: The family of Virginia Giuffre, who was one of Jeffrey Epstein's most prominent sex trafficking accusers, have said they are "outraged" over the US Department of Justice's release of an interview with Ghislaine Maxwell.
items.content: The family of Virginia Giuffre, who was one of Jeffrey Epstein's most prominent sex trafficking accusers, have said they are "outraged" over the US Department of Justice's release of an interview with Ghislaine Maxwell.

items.title: Ghislaine Maxwell denies seeing 'inappropriate' conduct by Trump
items.standfirst: Maxwell was interviewed after pressure on Trump to release information about whether prominent figures were involved in Jeffrey Epstein's crimes.
items.content: Maxwell was interviewed after pressure on Trump to release information about whether prominent figures were involved in Jeffrey Epstein's crimes.

ai_summary: Virginia Giuffre's family expressed outrage over the interview release.
The US Department of Justice released an interview with Ghislaine Maxwell.
Maxwell was interviewed after pressure regarding Epstein's crimes.
Maxwell denied seeing any inappropriate conduct by Donald Trump.
The interview's release has caused controversy and strong reactions.
